titleStmt.title: A machine-readable dictionary of Egyptian Arabic

sourceDesc.p: This is an original digital text

revisionDesc.change: 2814 records 2801 lemma records 7 mwu records 1 example records
3581 records 2920 lemma records 80 mwu records 439 example records

div.head: A digital dictionary of Cairo Arabic
div.p: To query the dictionary go here .
To obtain concise information on the dictionary go here .

sense.def: a sweet dessert made of semolina, butter, sugar and rosewater
Süßigkeit aus Gries, Butter, Zucker und Rosenwasser
sweet dessert made of pastry, butter, sugar und nuts, covered with sirup or honey
Süßigkeit aus Blätterteig, Butter, Zucker, und Nüssen, die mit Sirup oder Honig übergossen wird

sense.usg: a formal adress for a man of rank
formelle Anrede für einen höhergestellten Herrn
wird dem Substantiv wie ein Adj. nachgestellt, ist aber unveränderlich

cit.quote: to annoy, to bother, to aggravate
to bring, to get, to take

sense.def: third largest city of Egypt
drittgrößte Stadt Ägyptens
a type of buttery biscuits
eine Süßigkeit, die Vanillekipferln ähnlich ist

cit.quote: yes (in reply to an order or a request)
ja (als Antwort auf Befehl oder Aufforderung)
thank God (lit. praise be to God)
Gott sei Dank (wrtl. Lobpreis sei Gott)
to make, to cause (somebody to do something)
to take, to get, to obtain

body.entry:
kīlu كيلو
noun -
kiluwāt كيلوات
kilogram
Kilogramm, Stundenkilometer
kilometre
Kilometer
kilowatt
Kilowatt
s

sense.def: a pastry made from fine noodles, soaked in syrup or honey
Süßigkeit aus Nudeln, Zucker, Honig, Mandeln und Nüssen gebacken

cit.quote: ein Reisgericht mit Linsen und Zwiebeln

sense.def: eine Art Flammeri aus Reismehl, Milch und Zucker

cit.quote: never mind, don’t worry, it doesn’t matter
traveller, passenger; away on a journey

sense.def: = ya-STa

cit.quote: to put back, to put in place
to take away, to carry away

sense.def: ṭayyib
Egypt’s fifth largest city
particle used to introduce oaths
Schwurpartikel

cit.quote: You have to come at six o’clock on the dot.
Du musst pünktlich um sechs Uhr kommen.
Not at all! Your are welcome!

sense.gram: used to translate ever or never

cit.quote: Greater Eid, Feast of the Sacrifice
Egyptian middle class man, Egyptian man in western clothes
I have been standing in front of the school for an hour.
Ich stehe schon eine Stunde vor der Schule.
to be mistaken, to make a mistake
to learn by heart, to remember
to go downhill, to go below
to be left over, to remain
to be so kind as to ...
to go for a walk, to go for a stroll
to be recorded, to be registered
to extinguish, to put out fire
to come out, to go out
to know, to get to know, to learn
to master, to be in command

sense.usg: a polite way of addressing a woman
form of adress of a skilled craftsman such as an experienced carpenter, a plumber etc.
Anrede an einen erfahrenen Handwerker, einen Tischler, Installateur etc.
respectful form of address to a man or a woman
höfliche Anrede an einen Mann oder eine Frau

cit.quote: Excuse me? I beg your pardon?
Wie bitte? Was haben Sie gesagt?
We will travel with Egypt Air.
Wir werden mit Egypt Air fliegen.
He toils to feed the children.
Er müht sich ab, die Kinder zu ernähren.
to dig, to shovel, to rake
mīn iṛ-ṛāgil da? – da ṣaḥbi. (huwwa ṣaḥbi)
Who is this man? – He is my friend
di ʕaṛabiyyit mīn? – di l-ʕaṛabiyya btaʕitna. (hiyya) ṣġayyara bassᴵ kwayyisa.
Whose car is this? – This is our car. It’s small but it’s good.

fs.f: Demonstr. f., Stat. constr. fem. Suffix 1Pl., gut, klein, aber

cit.quote: bitiʕmili ʔēh dilwaʔti, yā faṭma? – batfaṛṛag ʕa-t-tilifizyōn.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV.
Fatima, was tust du gerade? – Ich sehe fern.
Why didn’t he come? – I don’t know.
Warum ist er nicht gekommen? - Ich weiß es nicht.
Where is my mobile (phone)? – Here it is!
Where are you (m./f.) going? – I am going home.
Where are you (m./f.; sg./pl.) from? – I am/ We are from Cairo.
ya-faṭma, ʔimta šufti mḥammad? – šuftu mbāriḥ.
Fatima, when did you see Muhammad? – I saw him yesterday.
ʔizzayyak? – kwayyis, (il-ḥamdu li-llāh). / ʔizzayyik? – kuwayyisa, (l-ḥamdu li-llāh).
Wie geht es dir (m./f.)? – Mir geht es gut.
How much is half a kilo of lemons? – It’s 10 (Pounds).
ʕandak kām walad? – ʕandi bintēn w-talat wilād.
How many children do you (f.) have? – I have two daughters and three sons.

fs.f: Kinder, Interd., Dual, haben, Tochter, Sohn, 3

cit.quote: saknīn fi manṭiʔit ēh? – iḥna saknīn fi z-zamālik.
In which neighbourhood do you live? – We live in Zamalik.
What are those women doing there? – They are baking bread.
Hey kids, tomorrow you have to study.
ʔis-sana lli fātit kān ʕandina mašākil kitīr.
Last year we had many problems.
Stay a bit longer! – No, I don’t have time.
Bleib noch ein bisschen da! - Nein, ich habe keine Zeit.

fs.f: bleiben, ein bißchen, nein, nicht haben.

cit.quote: Do you speak Arabic? – Just, a little.
Did you give the letter to Ahmad? – Yes, I gave it to him.
l-awlād šāfu šaḥḥāt waṛa l-bēt bitaʕna.
The children saw a beggar behind our house.
ʕawza tišrabi šāy walla ʔahwa? – šāy, law samaḥt.
Do you (f.) want to drink tea or coffee? – Tea please.
Can you (~do you know how to) play chess? – Yes.
Wir können die Miete nicht bezahlen.
gib-li l-ʔizāza l-kibīra, law samaḥt! – ʕala ʕēni w-rāṣi.
Bring me the big bottle, please! – I’m right with you.
ʕanduhum filus kitīr, bassᴵ humma nās miš kuwayyisīn.
They have a lot of money, but they are bad people.
fi faṣlina fīh tamantāšar ṭālib gidīd.
There are 18 new students in our class.
We have been here for 8 years.
gōzi lābis ʔamīṣ ʔabyaḍ. ʕandina ʕaṛabiyya bēḍa.
My husband wears a white shirt. We have a white car.
mabaḥibbᴵš (mabyiʕgibnīš) il-ʔamīṣ il-ʔaswad da. / mabaḥibbᴵš (mabtiʕgibnīš) il-ʕarabiyya s-sōda di.
I don’t like this black shirt/car.
ʔis-sittᴵ btaʕti štarit ʔamīṣ wardi/šanṭa wardi.
My wife bought a pink shirt/bag.
eine graue Mauer / eine graue Tasche
~Wer anderen eine Grube gräbt, fällt selbst hinein.
They are looking for a new flat.
ʔil-kitāb da yištimil ʕala xamas tibwāb.
The students’ hostel is in the city centre.
The plane took off at twelve o’clock.
Das Flugzeug hob um 12 Uhr ab.
The aeroplane arrived a bit late.
Das Flugzeug kam ein bisschen verspätet an.
kān ʕāwiz yirūḥ bassᴵ ḥaṣalit mašākil.
He wanted to go, but problems occurred.
Er wollte gehen, aber es ergaben sich Probleme.
They expelled him from the school.
Sie warfen ihn aus der Schule.
He will learn about it for sure.
What’s the matter? What is going on?
Can you wait for me in front of the school?
Kannst du vor der Schule auf mich warten?
He was sitting next to the emergency exit.
ʔiš-šanṭa di lāzim titḥaṭṭ fi r-raffᴵ fōʔ.
The bag must be put in the overhead compartment.
Die Tasche muss oben in das Gepäckfach gelegt werden.
She did not wish us good morning.
Sie hat uns keinen guten Morgen gewünscht.

cit.def: very common way of greeting someone; lit. peace be upon you
sehr verbreitete Art, jemanden zu begrüßen; wrtl. Friede sei mit dir

cit.quote: coffee-house owner; a person working in a coffee-house
Kaffeehausbesitzer; jemand, der in einem Kaffeehaus arbeitet
She is fearful for his reputation.
Sie sorgt sich um seinen guten Ruf.
My sister is also a student.
Meine Schwester ist auch eine Studentin.
sitt il-bēt mawgūda? - la, miš mawgūda.
Is the mistress at home? - No, she is not here.
Ist die Herrin zu Hause? - Nein, sie ist nicht da.
It is dangerous to get too close/involved.
Es ist nicht gut, etwas zu Nahe an sich heranzulassen.
The book is on the table.
Das Buch liegt auf dem Tisch.
forgive me sorry, no offence meant
Where are you from? - I am from Cairo.
Woher bist du? - Ich bin aus Kairo.
Es geht ihm nicht so gut.
I beg your pardon? I did not understand.
Wie bitte? Ich habe nicht verstanden.
Das haben andere auch schon probiert.
How are you?. - Thank you, fine.
Wie geht es Ihnen? - Danke, gut.
How are you? - Thank you, not so well.
Wie geht es Ihnen? - Danke, nicht so gut.
ʔizzayy abūk? - ʔaḥsan bi-ktīr, il-ḥamdu li-llāh.
How is your father? - Much better, thank God.
Wie geht es Ihrem Vater? - Gott sei dank, viel besser.
Ahmad ist immer noch im Krankenhaus.
How are you? - Not too bad.
Wie geht es Ihnen? - Es geht so.
What is the matter that you are so tired?
Was ist los mit dir, dass du so müde bist?
He has caught a slight cold.
It’s good to see you! (~ long time no see)
Schön dich zu sehen! (~ lange nicht gesehen)
Thank you, may you live long!
Danke, ich wünsche dir ein langes Leben.
Morgen geht es dir hoffentlich besser.
What is the meaning of this word?
The teacher is in the school.
Der Lehrer ist in der Schule.
He allowed us to come in.
The burnt child dreads the fire.
to sting, to bite (of a snake, an insect)
The teacher writes with a fountain pen.
Der Lehrer schreibt mit einer Füllfeder.
He loves this thing very much.
Er liebt diese Sache über alle Maßen.
The paint was spilled on the ground.
Die Farbe wurde auf den Boden geschüttet.
I have to leave. - Good bye.
Glad to meet you. - My pleasure.
Hat mich gefreut, Sie kennenzulernen. - Ganz meinerseits.
tiṣbaḥ ʕala xēr. - w-inta min ahlu.
Good night. - Good night to you.
Where are they? - I don’t know.
Wo sind sie? - Ich weiß es nicht.
Wo bist du auf die Welt gekommen?
Where are you from originally? From Aswan?
Woher bist du ursprünglich? Aus Assuan?
to be raised, to be educated
to stay away, to keep a distance (from)
to take away, to keep away (from)
Maybe, he is in the school.
Vielleicht ist er in der Schule.
The shop is right next to the school.
Das Geschäft ist gleich neben der Schule.
ʔil-balad di miš biʕīda min maṣṛ.
This town is not not far from Cairo.
Diese Stadt ist nicht weit von Kairo.
The children are loved by God.
to try, to make an effort
to become moist, to become damp
It is good to be patient.
What does he work? - He is an engineer.
Was arbeitet er? - Er ist ein Ingenieur.
Sie ist mit ihrer neuen Arbeit zufrieden.
ʔahwa turki, min faḍlak, wāḥid maẓbūṭ wa-wāḥid ʕa-r-riḥa.
Turkish coffee please, one with much sugar and one with only a little.
Türkischen Kaffee bitte, einen mit viel und einen mit ganz wenig Zucker.
Kaffee ohne Zucker für die Herren.
to add spicies or raisins and nuts
Gewürze oder Rosinen und Nüsse hinzufügen
They live at the beginning of the street.
Sie wohnen am Anfang der Straße.
The building is on the right side.
Das Gebäude ist auf der rechten Seite.
Come to see us! - With pleasure!
to take home, to send home
nach Hause bringen, nach Hause schicken
He will come in the night.
Er wird in der Nacht kommen.
haykūn fāḍi imta? - miš haykūn fāḍi abadan.
Will he have time tomorrow? - No, he will never be free.
Hat er morgen Zeit? - Er wird nie Zeit haben.
He will arrive the day after tomorrow.
At what time should I come? - Whenever you want.
Um wieviel Uhr soll ich kommen? - Wie du willst.
At what time will he arrive?
Um wieviel Uhr wird er ankommen?
The house is on the left side.
Drive in on the left side!
We saw him in the afternoon.
They set out in the morning.
They will arrive tomorrow or the day after tomorrow.
Sie werden morgen oder übermorgen ankommen.
ʔaḥmad ʕandu talat tixwāt wilād (/ ṣubyān) wi-aṛbaʕ tixwāt banāt.
Ahmad has three brothers and four sisters.
Ahmad hat drei Brüder und vier Schwestern.
cheap, of poor quality, badly done
ʕāwiz ʔahwa walla šāy? - wala ḥāga, šukṛ-an.
Do you want coffee or tea? - Nothing, thank you.
Möchtest du Kaffee oder Tee? - Gar nichts, danke.

sense.def: governmental office building on the Tahrir Square
Verwaltungsgebäude am Tahrir-Platz

cit.quote: After that we go to the school.
Danach gehen wir in die Schule.
Am besten nimmst du ein Taxi.
Get off at the Tahrir Square!
My wife is in the market.
Meine Frau ist auf dem Markt.

sense.usg: wird dem Substantiv wie ein Adj. nachgestellt, ist aber unveränderlich

cit.quote: to get chilled, to get cooled down
I want to drink something cold.

sense.def: thin paste made of ground sesame seeds

cit.quote: to come to rest, to settle, to stay
to put securely, to position, to place
to get angry, to get irritated
to became loose, to become slack
to sense, to feel, to perceive
to punch, to hit, to box
to call on sb., to drop by
to fall ill, to get sick
to make ill, to cause to be sick
to nurse, to attend to a patient
to fast, to abstain from food
to smash, to break into pieces
to become clear, to become obvious
I don’t see him any more.
He is looking for a grocery shop.
Never mind! Don’t bother about it!
Kümmere dich nicht darum! Es ist egal.
to date, to put a date on
They live in the city centre.
Sie wohnen im Zentrum der Stadt.
to fulfil, to let come true
to be unable, to be too weak
nicht tun können, nicht in der Lage sein
Ich kann dir nicht genug danken.
We visited him at the beginning of the month.
Wirbesuchten ihn am Anfang des Monats.
coin or note of ten piastres
to bring out, to take out
There is a nice garden around the house.
Um das Haus herum gibt es einen netten Garten.
There is even a palm tree in this garden.
In dem Garten ist sogar eine Palme.
The flat is on the third floor.
Die Wohnung ist im dritten Stock.
lāzim niṭlaʕ mašy ʕalašān il-aṣanṣēr ʕaṭlān.
We have to go up on foot because the lift has broken down.
Wir müssen zu Fuß hinaufgehen, weil der Lift kaputt ist.
Turn the air conditioner on because it is hot.
Schalte die Klimaanlage ein, weil es heiß ist.
lāzim yinām ʕala ṭūl li-ʔannu ṭaʕbān ʔawi.
He has to sleep immediately because he is very tired.
Er muss sofort schlafen, weil er sehr müde ist.
They had to remove a lymph node.
The poor one did not do anything.
He sent me a registered letter.
Er schickte mir einen eingeschriebenen Brief.
to cause to move, to get going, to walk someone
to get moving, to get going
Er ist wie vom Erdboden verschwunden.
ya-būya ʕala n-nās hināk. zaḥma ʔawi. tiṛušš il-malḥ mayinzilš.
My God, all these people there. It is really crowded. No room to swing a cat.
Mei Gott, so viele Menschen dort. Es ist eine Gedränge. Wie die Sardinen in der Dose.
to place orderly, to stack up
to be satisfied, to be content
He is going to the main square.
to recover (from an illness), to recuperate
to break down, to become useless,
to put right, to set straight
to get rid (of), to rid oneself (of)
to break, to fail to comply
Er hat sein Wort nicht gehalten.
to beget children, to have children
to hit, to bang, to pound
in the name of God, the Beneficient, the Merciful
im Namen Gottes, des Barmherzigen, des Gnädigen
He is flogging a dead horse.

sense.def: town in Upper Egypt

cit.quote: to cause to advance, to move forward
to submit, to bring forward, to present
to be faithful, to be reliable
to fill in data in a form
Munira holds the glass with the left hand.
Munira hält das Glas mit der linken Hand.
The pharmacy is on your right right.
Die Apotheke ist rechts von dir.
He works in the passport office.
They live on the first floor.
to receive (money), to be paid, to cash
(Geld) erhalten, bezhalt werden, in bar einlösen

sense.usg: used to add emphasis to questions
used with imperatives to express impatience

cit.quote: I wonder where is your father?
to carry out, to execute, to perform
to be disgusted, to be repelled
to almost do, to reach the point (of)
etwas fast tun, nahe daran sein
They approached the house of the mayor.
Sie näherten sich dem Haus des Bürgermeisters.
to become a Muslim, to convert to Islam
in die Nähe kommen, nahe kommen
The soldiers opened fire on him.
to get engaged (with), to ask to marry
Are you (m.) engaged? - No, not yet.
Bist du (m.) verlobt? - Nein, noch nicht.
Are you (f.) engaged? - No, not yet.
Bist du (f.) verlobt? - Nein, noch nicht.
to finish, to come to an end

sense.def: the tenth month of the Muslim calendar

cit.quote: di kānit awwil maṛṛa wāḥid maṣri yimsik markaz zayyᴵ da.
This was the first time that an Egyptian held such a position.
Das war das erste Mal, dass ein Ägypter so eine Positin hielt.
ʕayzīn ḥāga kwayyisa, miš ʔayyᴵ kalām.
They want something good, not just anything.
Sie wollen etwas Gutes, nicht einfach irgend etwas.
He wore a white loose shirt.
That’s ok! There is no objection.
Das passt (schon). Dem steht nichts entgegen.
mumkin titargimli kalām il-ustāz? - min ʕinayya!
Can you translate for me what the gentleman said? - With pleasure.
Können Sie mir übersetzen, was der Herr gesagt hat? - (Aber) gerne.
to push around, to be bossy
sich aufspielen, den Chef heraushängen lassen
He could not come with us.
Er konnte nicht mit uns kommen.
He arrived in the last moment.
breaking of the fast during Ramadan
to clip, to cut, to shear
This was something that made your mouth water.
Das ließ einem das Wasser im Munde zusammenlaufen.
I will not pay a (single) piastre!
That means that he will not come.
Das heißt, dass er nicht kommen wird.
to communicate, to tell, to report
to please, to give pleasure, to make happy
You want to open an account? That’s easy.
Sie möchten ein Konto eröffnen? Das ist leicht gemacht.

sense.def: an Egyptian card game
ein ägyptisches Kartenspiel

body.entry:
نقص niʔiṣ
nuʔuṣ نقص
verb I nqṣ
ينقص yinʔaṣ
to be missing (from)
fehlen
to need, to lack
s

cit.quote: What does she look like? - She looks very beautiful.
Wie sieht sie aus? - Sie sieht sehr schön aus.
to ask for more, to demand more
They have to rent a new flat.
Sie müssen eine neue Wohnung anmieten.
to bear, to tolerate, to endure, to put up with
to be proved, to become clear
He won’t be able to prove what he said.
Er wird nicht beweisen können, was er gesagt hat.
to remain in place, to be fixed, to stay
The cleared the building of people.
to drive away, to make run away
kān ʕāwiz yiṭaffišni ʕašān yixla bīha.
He wanted to drive me away to be alone with here.
to be safe, to be sound
to feel dizzy, to get giddy
to block, to obstruct, to damm
to make a stroke in rowing
belonging to the the Ayyubid dynasty/the Ayyubids
to rot, to decay of fruits or vegetables
to chop, to cut up, to mince

sense.def: respectful address for an Islamic scholar

cit.quote: to feel safe, to feel secure
Crusader, pertaining to the the Crusaders
to regard, to consider, to think of

sense.def: a pharao

cit.quote: to be done, to be made

sense.def: Egyptian solar deity

cit.quote: to be more than, to go beyond
to behanded over, to be given to
to be moved, to be transported
He could not stop over longer.
dafaʕtᴵ ʕala taṣlīḥ il-ʕaṛabiyya aktaṛ min tamanha.
I payed too much for the repair of the car.
May I try on the dress?
to manage, to deal with a problem
to execute, to put to death
to be tortured, to be tormented
to make ashamed, to shame, to embarrass
kullᴵ sana w-inta ṭayyib wi-ʕuʔbāl mīt sana!
The man is not able to manage his son.
Der Mann wird nicht mit seinem Sohn fertig.
to express, to voice, to speak out
The president made a press statement yesterday.
to make a pilgrimage to Jerusalem
My friend applied for a visa.
Mein Freund hat ein Visum beantragt.
All good things come from God.
zayyᴵ ma-ntu ʕarfīn il-burṣa hatiftaḥ yōm il-aṛbaʕ.
As you know the stock exchange will open on Wednesday.
Wie ihr wisst, wird die Börse am Mittwoch öffnen.
Every few days you disappear and then you come back.
to run away from one’s husband
kullᴵ šwayyit ayyām yiḍṛabni w-aġḍib ʕand ahli.
He beats me every few days and I run away to my parents.
to speak with a nasal voice
to escape, to run away, to flee
miš hahṛab! ana maʕamaltᴵš ḥāga galaṭ ʕašān ahṛab.
I will not run away! I did not do anything wrong that I should run away.
lāzim aʕṛaf ʔēh illi ḥaṣal luhum.
I have to know what has happened to them.
I will not leave her here alone.
magibtᴵš il-kitāb maʕāya in-nahaṛ-da. ḥagibhū-lak bukṛa ʔin-šāʔ-aḷḷāh.
I did not bring the book today. I will bring it for you tomorrow.
I will take my brother on this journey.
Ok, get into the room, guys!
Auf, geht bitte ins Zimmer, Leute!
ḥayxudna l-matḥaf il-maṣri yiwarri-lna mumiyāt il-faṛaʕna.
He will take us to the Egyptian Museum to show us the mummies of the Pharaos.
Will you have time next Friday?
Who has nothing to do acts as judge. (Somebody got nothing better to do than finding fault with others)
ʕāwiz ašūf is-sūʔ. mumkin tīgi maʕāya. - bi-kullᴵ surūr.
I would like to go to the market. Can you come with me? - Gladly:
You have came late, we have all been waiting for you.
tislam īd-ik ya-madām. mitšakkir ʔawi! - mitšakkir ʕala ʔēh? ma-ʕamaltᴵš ḥāga.
Thank you very much, Madam. - Oh, not at all. I did not do anything.
lēh baʔa bititʕibi nafs-ik kida? - la, di ḥagāt basīṭa.
ʔintu mabṣuṭīn hina fi maṣr. - ʔaywa, mabsuṭīn ʔawi.
Do you like it here in Cairo? - Yes, very much so.
ʔinta zaʕlān minni walla ʔeh? - laʔ, ʔabad-an.
Are you cross with me, or what? - No, not at all.
ʔilli ʔāʕid waṛa xāliṣ šāyif wala laʔ?
Do those that sit in the back see (anything), or not?
You must not criticise for no good reason.
nifsi ašūf ʕali yunʔud il-ahli maṛṛa waḥda bass.
I would like to see Ali criticise il-Ahli just once.
ʔinta baʔa ḍamīrak miš biyinʔaḥ ʕalēk?
Don’t you have a guilty conscience?
to spin, to twist, to roll
He borrowed a thousand pounds from the bank.
to lend, to lborrow, to loan
She lent me an interesting book.
the wife of one’s hunsband’s brother
You will not always get away. | Don’t push your luck!

to get along well with one another
